title: Deployment
text: following important arguments golem-config.yml file clinsight: app_prod: Controls production-related settings, whether warning shown study data older one day (thus possibly outdated), whether internal user database always synchronized starting ClinSight. recommended set TRUE application run production. user_identification: way user can identified. testing purposes, can set test_user. production, can set either shinymanager (Shinymanager deployments), http_headers (ShinyProxy deployments), shiny_session (Posit Connect deployments). study_data: default settings, path directly return internal package data testing purposes. production, argument contain file path study‚Äôs raw data, prepared .rds file. meta_data: default settings, path return example metadata testing purposes. production, argument contain file path metadata, prepared .rds file. user_db: Path user database SQLite file. doesn‚Äôt already exist, new database automatically generated file location. credentials_db: Path credentials database (.sqlite file). applicable shinymanager configuration. user_roles: List roles (format: Role Name: role_id) available application. allow_to_review: List role names (specified ) allowed review data application. allow_listing_download: Logical, TRUE users permitted download listings ClinSight application directly Excel sharing (uses). allow_query_inputs: Logical, `TRUE` permit users submit track queries within application‚Äôs database.

title: Deployment
text: Another way deployment can use shinyproxy. ShinyProxy fully open source software provides multiple options deploying shiny applications, built-support latest authentication authorization technologies OpenID Connect. serves shiny (data science) applications Docker containers. provides multiple advantages, among possibility run applications fully isolated, deploy multiple versions application. guide provides brief hints get started ShinyProxy deployment. First download install ShinyProxy according instructions ShinyProxy website. second step store ClinSight Docker image. good place start images Rocker Project, can relatively quick setup. Alternatively, smaller Docker images less dependencies (thus possibly less security vulnerabilities) can created Alpine Linux images. images probably take longer build, since Rstudio Package Manager provides binaries Alpine Linux time writing, meaning R packages need installed source. Within Docker file, install ClinSight. reduce R package dependencies size Docker image, renv profile minimal can used. profile contains minimal number required packages order run application. installing clinsight Docker image, create folder named study_data current user‚Äôs home directory. set configuration shinyproxy create CMD line similar : Next, ensure ShinyProxy configuration .yml file setup correctly. example get started. Note settings assume openID Connect used authentication. Configuring properly outside scope guide; see ShinyProxy documentation details . important notes: data volume needs mounted docker container order application run correctly. Docker container user also needs writing access folder. User names passed using HTTP headers. Since HTTP headers handle UTF-8 characters, user names need base64 encoded shown example .yml file.
code: ENV GOLEM_CONFIG_ACTIVE="shinyproxy" CMD R -e "options('shiny.port'=3838, shiny.host='0.0.0.0', golem.app.prod = TRUE); clinsight::run_app()" proxy:   title: "ClinSight Portal"   port: 8080   authentication: openid   container-wait-time: 60000   openid:     auth-url: ...     jwks-url: ...     token-url: ...     client-id: ...     client-secret: ...     username-attribute: email     roles-claim: roles   docker:     internal-networking: true   admin-groups: admin   specs:   - id: clinsight     container-image: clinsight_image:latest     container-volumes: ["LOCAL_DATA_FOLDER/study_data:/home/clinsight_user/study_data"]     container-network: internal_network     http-headers:       X_SP_USERNAME: "#{T(java.util.Base64).getEncoder().encodeToString(oidcUser.getFullName().getBytes())}"

title: App Configuration & Input Data Specifications
text: RDS file (data.frame) ported study_data element contains following required columns . site_code: character integer, identifier study site; integer, recommended add prefix ‚ÄúSite‚Äù display intuitively application‚Äôs UI subject_id: character, unique identifier subject event_repeat: integer, helps keep track unique event_id single subject_id event_date event_id: character, names help classify types event_names like-groups, generally characterized site visits. example, ‚ÄúSCR‚Äù screening visit, ‚ÄúVIS‚Äù Visit X (X integer), ‚ÄúEXIT‚Äù patient exits study trial. However, event_ids track events apply outside visit, like AE, ConMed, Medical History, etc. event_name: character, ‚Äúevent‚Äù generally characterizes sort site visit, whether ‚ÄúScreening‚Äù, ‚ÄúVisit X‚Äù (X integer), ‚ÄúExit‚Äù, ‚ÄúVisit‚Äù. event_date: Date, date associated event_name form_id: character, unique identifier form item_name metric item_value pulled . Note: item_type continuous, form_id can contain several different item_groups. However, item_type ‚Äò‚Äô, item_group can made several form_id values. form_repeat: integer, helps keep track unique item_names collected specific form_id given subject_id. form_repeat particularly helpful consolidating data like Adverse Events data format. Specifically, one AE collected patient, ‚Äôll one form_repeat edit_date_time: datetime (POSIXct), last time record edited db_update_time: datetime (POSIXct), last time database storing record updated. region: character, describing region code site_code falls day: difftime number, meaning contains number unit time. measures number days visit screening vis_day: numeric, numeric representation day vis_num: numeric, numeric representation event_name event_label: character, abbreviation event_name item_name: character, describes metric parameter interest. item_type: character, classifies item_names either ‚Äòcontinuous‚Äô ‚Äò‚Äô, continuous types generally associated CDISC ‚Äúbasic data structure‚Äù (BDS). , item_name metric collected time patient visit (event_name). ‚Äò‚Äô type represents non-time dependent measures, like demographic info, adverse events, Medications, medical history, etc. item_group: character, provides high level category groups like-item_names together. example, item_group = ‚ÄòVital Signs‚Äô group together pertinent item_name metrics like BMI, Pulse, Blood pressure, etc. item_value: character, measurement collected given item_name. value collected may number like 150 (collecting patient‚Äôs weight) word (‚Äòwhite‚Äô subject‚Äôs race). item_unit: character, tracking unit measurement item_name item_value. lower_lim: numeric, item_names (particularly ‚Äòcontinuous‚Äô type) pre-defined range values considered normal. lower limit range. upper_lim: numeric, item_names (particularly ‚Äòcontinuous‚Äô type) pre-defined range values considered normal. upper limit range. significance: character, either ‚ÄòCS‚Äô means ‚ÄòClinically Significant‚Äô ‚ÄòNCS‚Äô means ‚ÄòClinically Significant‚Äô reason_notdone: character, effort describe item_value field NA / missing.

title: App Configuration & Input Data Specifications
text: meta_data object list data.frames (surprisingly) contains metadata information application. provide study-specific settings, controls study data application visible. can created right format changing Excel template data-raw/metadata.xlsx, create metadata object functionget_metadata (e.g.¬†meta <- clinsight::get_metadata("path--custom-metadata.xlsx")). meta_data object saved .rds file clinsight can use (e.g.¬†saveRDS(meta, "data_folder/metadata.rds")). stated previously, metadata also used shape raw study_data right format, dictate variables included study_data. can done using function merge_meta_with_data(), described detail next section. goal , study-specific data captured metadata, leaving scripts run application largely unaltered studies. Just like study_data, package also bundles built-metadata object called metadata. view example metadata file, run following chunk code: Specifications list data.frames include: column_names: Used map raw data variable names new names. name_raw: character, variable name raw data source name_new: character, desired variable name use study_data application events: Used create simple timeline application, predefined number planned visits, N. contains following columns: event_number: integer. Example: 0, 1, 2, ‚Ä¶, N event_name: character. Example: ‚ÄúScreening‚Äù, ‚ÄúVisit 1‚Äù, ‚ÄúVisit 2‚Äù, ‚Ä¶, ‚ÄúVisit N‚Äù event_label: character. Example: ‚ÄúV0‚Äù, ‚ÄúV1‚Äù, ‚ÄúV2‚Äù, ‚Ä¶, ‚ÄúVN‚Äù common_forms: Used select rename variables interest raw data transformed desired study_data format. Note: creating study_data data.frame use merge_meta_with_data() (surprisingly), metadata merged raw study data. common_forms contains columns : var: character, variable name display table, mapped known item_name provided study_data. Example: item_name = "AE Name" replaced ‚ÄúAE_AETERM‚Äù var = "AE_AETERM". suffix: Usually blank data.frame. column commonly used study_forms data.frame item_name: character, known item_names found study_data. certain item_names required, even missing study_data, including: ‚ÄúAE Name‚Äù, ‚ÄúAE start date‚Äù, ‚ÄúAE end date‚Äù, ‚ÄúAE date worsening‚Äù, ‚ÄúAE CTCAE severity‚Äù, ‚ÄúAE CTCAE severity worsening‚Äù, ‚ÄúSerious Adverse Event‚Äù, ‚ÄúSAE Start date‚Äù. item_type: character, known item_type corresponding found item_names study_data. item_group: character, known item_group corresponding found item_names study_data. study_forms: Contains columns data.frame common_forms, addition columns unit, lower_limit, upper_limit. Used select rename raw data variables interest. addition, suffix column used regularly ‚Äústudy‚Äù context. , variable names may consistent trunk / stem, varying suffixes describe similar style measurement. instead creating new row variables meta_data data.frame, allow inclusion several suffixes. example, VS_PULSE measures beats/min. Typically, measures collected using VS_PULSE_VSORRES & VS_PULSE_VSREAND, format, can list stem ‚ÄúVS_PULSE‚Äù var "VSORRES, VSREAND" suffix field. new columns, defined follows: unit: character, unit measure lower_limit: numeric, lower limit ‚Äôs considered clinically significant upper_limit: numeric, upper limit ‚Äôs considered clinically significant general: Contains columns common_forms used way. , ‚Äôs used select rename raw data transformed desired study_data format. Note: creating study_data data.frame use merge_meta_with_data() (surprisingly), metadata merged raw study data. Please refer common_forms spec . However, note certain item_names required, even missing study_data, including: ‚ÄúAge‚Äù, ‚ÄúSex‚Äù, ‚ÄúECOG‚Äù, ‚ÄúEligible‚Äù, ‚Äú.classification‚Äù, ‚ÄúDiscontinuationReason‚Äù, ‚ÄúDrugAdminDate‚Äù, ‚ÄúDrugAdminDose‚Äù. groups: Contains columns item_group, item_type, item_scale,use_unscaled_limits. table_names: Used renaming table column names readable format. required name column names; column names defined , raw name used instead. table_name: character, raw_name: character,

title: ClinSight
text: ClinSight provides production-ready easy--use application medically monitoring patient safety data integrity throughout clinical trials. application provides smart review platform interactive visualizations, creating efficient patient overview usually achieved native ‚ÄòElectronic Data Capture‚Äô (EDC) interfaces.

Patient data patterns time can easily visualized interactive figures, highlighting data points normal limits, indicating whether data point newly entered/changed EDC since last review session. title: Clinical Trial test data ‚Äî clinsightful_data
text: data.frame containing randomly created clinical trial data. Used testing purposes. also used run app example data executing run_app() default configuration settings, running either test_clinsight() golem::run_dev(). See also vignette('Metadata') vignette('clinsight') explanation create custom study data clinsight.

title: Clinical Trial test data ‚Äî clinsightful_data
text: data.frame 6076 rows 22 variables. site_code: character integer, identifier study site. subject_id: character, unique identifier subject. event_id: character, event identifier raw data. Replaced event_name event_label within ClinSight. "event" generally characterizes sort site visit (e.g. "Screening", "Visit 1", "Visit 2"). Note event_ids track events apply outside visit, like AE, ConMed, Medical History, etc. event_name: character, name event identifier used within application. Created merging raw data metadata. event_label: character, shorter name event identifier. Created merging raw data metadata. Used instead event_name compact visualizations. event_date: Date, date associated event_name. event_repeat: integer, keeps track unique event_id single subject_id event_date. form_id: character, unique form_id identifier. Currently unused; item_group used instead, controlled using metadata. form_repeat: integer, keeps track unique item_names collected specific form given subject_id. form_repeat particularly helpful consolidating data like Adverse Events data format. Specifically, one AE collected patient, one form_repeat. edit_date_time: date-time (POSIXct), last time record edited. region: character, describing region code site_code falls . day: difftime() R object, measuring number days visit screening. vis_day: numeric, numeric representation day. Created merging raw data metadata. vis_num: numeric, numeric representation event_name. Created merging raw data metadata. counted scheduled events (can controlled metadata). item_name: character, name metric parameter interest. item_type: character, classifies item_names either 'continuous' '', continuous types generally associated CDISC "basic data structure" (BDS). , item_name metric collected time patient visit (event_name). '' type represents non-time dependent measures, like demographic info, adverse events, Medications, medical history, etc. item_group: character, defines form items item_name appear. item_value: character, measurement collected given item_name. value collected may number like 150 (collecting patient's weight) word ('white' subject's race). item_unit: character, tracking unit measurement item_name item_value. lower_lim: numeric, item_names (particularly 'continuous' type) pre-defined range values considered normal. lower limit range. upper_lim: numeric, item_names (particularly 'continuous' type) pre-defined range values considered normal. upper limit range. significance: character, either 'CS' means 'Clinically Significant' 'NCS' means 'Clinically Significant'. reason_notdone: character, effort describe item_value field NA / missing.

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2) library(plotly) set.seed(2023) # for reproducible jitter fig <- ggplotly({   ggplot(iris, aes(factor(1), Petal.Width)) + geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA) +      geom_jitter(col = "red") +      facet_wrap(~Species)  })  # Outliers are visible in black in the plotly figure, even though they should not: fig  #The function `remove_boxplot_outliers()` corrects for this: remove_boxplot_outliers(ggplotly(fig)) } # }

title: clinsight 0.2.0
text: Added feature , applicable tables, user can navigate form double-clicking table row (#103). Merging raw study data metadata made flexible. now possible run multiple user-defined, custom functions process creating clinsight-compatible user data. custom functions can declared metadata‚Äôs settings tab (#119, #120). Functionality added declare item pairs metadata merged needed. Useful add additional information variable table sometimes available (#171). standard interactive tables now flexible. example, columns can now re-organized user (#124). Added form type class used create_table() display tables, enabling flexibility creating study data tables. way data stored pulled database simplified leveraging native SQL table update logging mechanisms (#115, #135), reviewing records IDs instead subject form Reviewing data simplified reviewing data records IDs instead subject & form (#135). now much easier select event names show application order. addition, easier edit event‚Äôs short long labels (#140). Query handling now configurable option (#156). Figure legend improved display ‚Äòsignificance pending‚Äô instead ‚Äòsignificance unknown‚Äô (#154). now possible enable button downloading tables ClinSight (#153). interactive timeline now consistent labels, center item click, customizable treatment labels (setting settings$treatment_label metadata) (#152). Filters mod_study_forms now triggered delay, improving user experience trying select/deselect multiple items (#168). company-independent graphic now shown logo top left corner (#184). version ClinSight now show application‚Äôs sidebar (#194). Settings data/clinsight information sidebar now aligned bottom (#194). Tables forms now keep showing data active subject first default, even changing table view show subject‚Äôs data table (#190). Engineered study_name field meta$settings display official study name app (#197).

title: clinsight 0.2.0
text: test-coverage GHA workflow updated codecov uploads work (#139). Display rows tables Scroller disabled (#150). Tables continuous data now show reason missing data information new, instead showing NA (#168). Fixed ordering adverse events bold HTML tags added. Adverse events now show newest event first default (#168). Fixed issue newly added columns SAE table show (#206). Items yet reviewed displayed bold now show intended, removing custom logic create_table (#168).

title: clinsight 0.2.0
text: Added recent repo snapshot chromote v0.5.0 used Shiny tests (#180). resolves errors using latest version Chrome (v135 later) shinytest2 tests. Added test_clinsight() function developing testing custom data metadata use ClinSight (#185). now ,new Chrome headless browser mode used shinytest2 tests unit tests can run Chrome v132 later (#161). Added raw data can used completely recreate internal dataset (clinsightful_data) merge functions package (#162). Refactored mod_study_forms, mod_common_forms, mod_review_forms_tbl, now need data one form instead study data. Moved business logic form tables helper functions mod_review_forms_tbl. reduces unnecessary refreshing data saving review. Added two helper functions (create_clinsight_metadata() create_clinsight_config) create custom ClinSight metadata config files (#175). Added feature test row level review (#182). Added ‚Äúdeploy‚Äù profile deployments. Includes additional dependencies included ‚Äúdeploy_minimal‚Äù profile deployments utilizing shinymanager app.R file, restrictive ‚Äúfull‚Äù profile (#191). Renamed internal review record objects improved clarity (#202).

title: clinsight 0.1.0
text: Improved metadata external file can used. Improved data loading using config file. Created two renv profiles, one development one production. Goal minimize package dependencies production version. Removed development package dependencies (example devtools) needed run application. Improved data anonymization. Changed license. Updated Description file. Improved reading data files within clinsight::run_app() Improved creating test result report. Added data specification run_app() documentation Improved function get_test_results(). Merged data now attribute ‚Äòsynch_time‚Äô used update synchronization information side bar. user roles defined config.yml now shown several places application documented alongside user name needed. Provided scaffolding developers plan deploy Posit Connect Improved dataTable outputs Move shinymanager suggests since optional use . Add functionality mark forms required review . Improved required column verification metadata columns reading metadata using get_metadata(). Improved visibility queries, especially longer query text smaller screen resolutions. Adds option view query details full screen.
